full_text.full_text:
Linear vs. Nonlinear
▪ Linear classifiers
– Use a linear separating hyperplane to discriminate instances from 
different classes (e.g., logistic regression)
– Less flexible, but less susceptible to model overfitting
▪ Nonlinear classifiers
– Construct more complex, nonlinear decision surface (e.g., deep learning)
– More flexible, but more susceptible to model overfitting
5
